intro: Acetosella tuberosa, commonly known as the tuberous sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive rosette of succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers in early spring, which are clustered in umbels. Its tuberous roots are edible and have a tangy, sour flavor similar to rhubarb. Acetosella tuberosa thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
